subject: Re: Junit4.9b1 not work
msgSnippet: Emanuela, I m afraid I m out of ideas.  When I m at a computer later, I ll double-check that the jar is well-formed.  In the meantime, maybe people who have
messageBody:
Emanuela,

I'm afraid I'm out of ideas. When I'm at a computer later, I'll
double-check that the jar is well-formed. In the meantime, maybe
people who have more recently worked on Windows can chime in...

David Saff

On Thu, Jan 20, 2011 at 9:48 AM, Emanuela <manuspa_72@...> wrote:
> Hi everyone,  I could not find the jar tool, where should it be?
> I'm not able to work with Junit again.
> Thank you for your help
> Bye Emanuela
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>>
>> Emanuela,
>>
>> Were you able to find the jar tool, and use it to find the contents of
>> the jar on your classpath?
>>
>>    David Saff
>>
>> On Thu, Jan 20, 2011 at 3:46 AM, Emanuela Bertelli <manuspa_72@...> wrote:
>> > Sorry but not work again see the message error:
>> >
>> > C:\TOOL_TEST\JUnit\junit4.9b2>"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" or
>> > g.junit.runner.JUnitCore org.junit.tests.AllTests
>> > Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/junit/runner/JUni
>> > tCore
>> > Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.junit.runner.JUnitCore
>> >         at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
>> >         at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
>> >         at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
>> >         at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
>> >         at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
>> >         at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
>> > Could not find the main class: org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.  Program will exit.
>> >
>> >
>> > Can you help me?
>> > Thank so much... Emanuela
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> > ________________________________
>> > Da: patrick doran-wu <galoif@...>
>> > A: junit@yahoogroups.com
>> > Inviato: Mer 19 gennaio 2011, 19:23:59
>> > Oggetto: [junit] Re: Junit4.9b1 not work
>> >
>> >
>> > Hi,
>> >
>> > Problem fixed.
>> > I did not completely convert over from junit3 to junit4.
>> > I had the testclass still inheriting from junit3 TestCase.
>> > It all works now.
>> >
>> > Thanks for your help,
>> > Patrick
>> >
